moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf: The Perenyi Attack, an attempt to play Keres like attack against the Najdorf.
moves.7... e5 8. Nf5 h5 9. g5 Nxe4 10. Nxg7+ B: Black has a mobile pawn center and an advantage in space.
moves.12. Ng3 d4 13. Bd2 Qd5 14. Rg1 Bg4 15. B: I believe this to be a novelty. at least I didn't find it in my database.  16. Bxg4 and 16 f3 are the most popular moves.
moves.16... f5: ? First move on my own and it's bad.  Fritz likes 16...e4
moves.17. Bxg4: ?! White misses a chance to get large advantage.  Fritz gives 17. f3 f4 18. fxg4 fxg3 19 gxh5.
moves.18. Qe2: Here Black should play 18...Nc5 19. Nf5 (19. O-O-O e4; 19. Bf4 O-O-O) Bf8 20. g6 Rg8.
moves.18... O-O-O 19. Nf5: ?!  Fritz suggests 19. Qe4 Qe6 and Black only has an edge.
moves.19... Bf8: The Black Bishop dominates the White Knight.  Black now has a clear advantage
moves.20. a3 e4: I liked this move a lot.  I have my hanging pawns abreast and threaten the White Knight.
moves.21. Ng3: ?  Black is now full in control. Fritz suggests 21 Nxd4!?
moves.22. O-O-O: ??  White's game collapses.  Relatively better was 22. Kd1 but Black would still be winning.
moves.22... Qe6: ? gives White a chance to get back in the game with 23. Kb1 preventing Black's next.
moves.24. Bf4: ??  creating an escape square for the king, but Bb4 was relatively better although Black should still win.
moves.25. bxa3 Qa1+ 26. Kd2 Qc3+ 27. Kc1 Nc5 2: 30 Qb5 axb5 31. Rxe4 would have held out a little longer.
